alert.note: Alert for Smyth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 12:33PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Smyth County through 115 PM EDT... At 1231 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms that extended along Interstate 81 from Chilhowie to Marion to just west of Rural Retreat...moving east-southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Significantly reduced visibility in areas of heavy rainfall. Minor flooding of low-lying and normally flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Marion... Chilhowie... Mount Rogers National Recreation Area... Marion Wytheville... Adwolf... Hungry Mother State Park... and Atkins. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
